programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening (Letter X, Y & Z) (26/28)
programme.desc: «Letter X, Y & Z»Carol explores subjects that all begin with the letters X, Y & Z.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For the first of three visits this year, Sammi Kinghorn is on a hill farm in Cumbria, catching up with a passionate young farmer, 16-year-old Katie. From dawn to dusk, it's all go as Katie and Sammi get stuck into the daily chores and a surprise birth. But it's not just the farm keeping Katie busy this year - it's also GCSE year! Sammi finds out how this determined young lady is not fazed as she juggles her studies with caring for her animals. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales, and in a new strand, we meet four young farmers from around the country to follow their trials and tribulations over the next few months.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Diana Yates are at the garden outside Aberdeen where they are continuing to mark the show's 45th anniversary by planting blue-themed varieties. This time, it's container planting. At the garden, they demonstrate how to produce homemade fertiliser using comfrey. George Anderson has an update from his own garden in Joppa, and Beechgrove's head gardener, Scott Smith, has a back-to basics guide on how to spot when your seedlings are ready for potting on.

programme.title: Landward (8/26)
programme.desc: Dougie takes a walk through the woods at Yair Estate in the Tweed Valley.

programme.title: Pour tous les jardins du monde (The Med: Spain/Morocco/Italy) (7/10)
programme.desc: «The Med: Spain/Morocco/Italy»In Italy, Monty visits some of the high Renaissance gardens.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: The best bits and favourite moments from Saturday Kitchen.

programme.title: The Big Family Cooking Showdown S2
programme.desc: Four foodie families cook it out for a place in the next round of the competition.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain (1/4)
programme.desc: Rick Stein begins his culinary tour in Galicia on the Atlantic coast.

programme.title: Un pyjama pour deux
programme.desc: Rival advertising executives do battle over a non-existent product.

programme.title: Stage Three
programme.desc: Coverage of stage three of RideLondon 2023.

programme.title: Flog It ! S16
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from Bristol Cathedral in the south west of England. Antique experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and James Lewis are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. Natasha comes across a painting of an apothecary on a piece of tin and James looks at a valuable royal ring which was found at a car boot sale. Paul Martin learns about John Cabot and his ship the Matthew, whose crew discovered North America.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers (Going the Distance) S1 (5/6)
programme.desc: «Going the Distance»Paul follows the eastward course of the South Esk from its source above Glen Clova.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy (Rome) S1 (2/6)
programme.desc: «Rome»Stanley Tucci heads to Rome in search of the city's famous four pastas.

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America (Bolivia to Paraguay) S1 (n°4)
programme.desc: «Bolivia to Paraguay»Simon crosses the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazil's Pantanal and the forests of Paraguay.

programme.title: Barry Humphries at the BBC
programme.desc: When the great Barry Humphries passed away last month, the world said goodbye to a comedian whose antics had for years had kept presenters, interviewers and chat-show hosts on their toes, half-excited and half-terrified of what outrageous statement he, Dame Edna Everage or Sir Les Patterson might utter on live television. Alex Jones looks back at the highlights of Barry's career on a selection of BBC shows, sharing her own memories alongside some of Barry's funniest, rudest and most revealing moments from over the decades. It's a collection that demonstrates exactly why Sir Les and Dame Edna were loved by comedy fans across the world, while also highlighting how, while his two comic creations may have got all the attention, it was Barry who was really one of a kind.

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob (1/2)
programme.desc: Howard Jacobson reflects on the cultural impact made by four rebellious Australians.

programme.title: Rebels of Oz: Germaine, Clive, Barry and Bob (2/2)
programme.desc: Howard Jacobson charts the ascent of the four rebels to national and international icons.

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes Almost Australian (The Lucky Country) S1 (3/3)
programme.desc: «The Lucky Country»Miriam visits the Gulf of Carpentaria to see where the Lucky Country's wealth comes from.
